page.title: 03FARMING AROUND BIGGLESWADE
page.content: The generally flat & open countryside is put to extensive agricultural and horticultual use, & there are several large farms & holdings. Although the industry is now highly mechanised, a surprisingly high proportion of people still work actively on the land, especially in tending & harvesting vegetables. The main crops are cereals with large areas devoted to sprouts, cabbage, lettuce etc., and in recent years oil seed rape has been grown, which transforms the countryside to a vivid yellow when in bloom. As well as vegetables of all kinds, flowers are grown for marketing, adding to the attractive piecemeal effect of the fields. Many very large greenhouses are in evidence, growing tomatoes, flowers & other tender plants, in par- ticular those where it is of material advantage to have an early harvest.
